result.execSummary:
The defendant Dushawn M Vaden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 45 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of
 12 MONTHS:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 10 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          until February 12, 2015 by 5:00 pm.  
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Court WAIVED all mandatory and non-mandatory costs due to defendant's financial instability. 
     *   Successfully complete (20) hours of community
          service.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

Defendant Dushawn M Vaden in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. aa

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 4, 2015.  Received and filed.  aa

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Dushawn M Vaden not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Dushawn M Vaden not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for speedy projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dushawn M Vaden in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Dushawn M Vaden in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
